question: What is Section 7 of the RBI Act 1934?
option1: It allows RBI to buy and sell Foreign currency
option2: It empowers the government to issue directions to the RBI
option3: It allows the RBI to appoint its own staff
answer: It empowers the government to issue directions to the RBI
explanation: The Section 7 in the RBI Act empowers the government to issue directions to the RBI. Although this section has never been used by the central govt, it puts a restriction on the autonomy of the RBI.
